text: By far the best bar I have been to while I stayed at my sisters for my Vacay... All I have to say is the waitress that helped me rocks ... And the bartender that helped me yesterday rocks too... Thanks for the Fire Cracker drink it was awesome. I hope this gets to them. I really do.

Cain's has great BBQ and the best bruschetta I've ever had, but DO NOT go there on a game day unless you enjoy the fact that all 50 televisions have their volume jacked to the the max. My fiancé walked in and walked directly back out the door with nothing but an instant headache.

Do not order steak or prime rib here.  The prime rib, ordered rare, was medium, dry and extremely salty.  The rib eye was thinly cut, salty and dry.  When I told the waitress, she said the chef said it should not have been and maybe I did something to it, like it was my fault.  I felt insulted.  The bill was $38.00 so it is pricey.  I was very disappointed and would not order anything but wings here.

I Just found Cain's about two months ago - love it! Great service, very friendly and the best food I've had in the south hills.  Their draft beer selection is good and tastes great (hate flat draft beer) Bloody Mary Bar on weekends is amazing! Good seating and a nice mixed crowd. We didn't know what to expect when we tried their breakfast, but it is as good as Grand Concourse - no exaggerating - we will definitely be regulars. Cain's truly is family friendly, which is why we first tried it and we love it.  The chef always walks past and asks how your food is - great touch!

Used to go there weekly when I was in college. When it was just a bar. Went there for breakfast on father's day for breakfast and it was fantastic ! One if the best I've ever had. Huge menu.  They've really cleaned the place up. I would highly recommend a visit.

I really can't believe this place is still open due to the service and the food. I came here with 3 other people and all of us felt disrespected, ignored and abused. At one point I had to call the manager and he flat out told me to shut up at one point. I'm an adult, not a child, and wtf is he thinking that he told me to shut up he's lucky I didn't flip the table then and there. Believe me if you ever want to be treated like an adult and have a nice meal avoid this place like the plague. This place is a cancerous sore in dormont, and with cancer you get rid of it. This place should be torn down and turned into something nice that supports people and doesn't leave a sour taste when you leave. This place is sad.
The wings here are fantastic and the cheese sticks are absurd in a very good way.  Great atmosphere. Really good service. I could not recommend Cain's more.  My favorite bar in Pittsburgh.

I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries, my burger was pink on the inside..not how I like to eat them.  Our waitress was initially very helpful and took it back to the kitchen to have them cook it longer for me.  25 minutes later my date had finished his meal and my fries were gone.  Our waitress never returned to let me know what was going on, when she did I ended up asking her to just box my burger up for me to go thinking I would eat it for lunch the next day.  When I re-heated the supposedly re-cooked burger the following day it was still pink on the inside.  So I am not sure what the kitchen had been doing for 25 minutes but it was not cooking my burger.  We will not be returning here!

The place is well put together but It's over priced and the service is terrible.  Tonight was no different than any other night I've had at Cain's.  An hour after ordering appetizers and burgers I walked up to a waitress who wasn't waiting our table and asked on status of our order.  One minute later all of our food was delivered cold.  I think it's reasonable to expect your wings to be delivered before the main course but I'd certainly expect the food to be warm.  It's also really expensive.  A table of three at Cain's, who spent two hours drinking and waiting on our meal, was way over $100.  I didn't do a line by line break down of our bill but I'd guess the place carries a 20% premium over other bars in the area.  Maybe worth it if the experience was enjoyable but my friends and I usually leave more frustrated then when we walked in.  It's not worth the money.  The place had a great location but otherwise it's a waste.  I'm personally finished with the place.

Recently went back to give Cain's another shot. Even though the service was bad the last time I was there, the food was always good. I haven't given the dining room a second try yet, but when I sat in the bar the service was actually good. The bartender was attentive and I never had a problem getting his attention if I needed anything. The food was good, it was served fast, and the portions were huge as usual. Although I am still a bit hesitant to sit in the dining room, I will definitely go back again after this recent experience to at least sit in the bar area.

I would give this place half a star if I could. The service was the most appalling I have ever experienced. We ordered sandwiches and fries and waited a FULL HOUR for our food. After 30 minutes of waiting we had to glad down our waitress to find out how much longer, she laughed it off and said there were three tickets in front of us still. Our veggie burgers and fries came out cold but by that point we wear starved and not about to send our precious food back to that black hole of a kitchen, where apparently time doesn't exist. The waitress gave us our check, stated that the manager would not do anything for us for the long wait and she "did what she could" and discounted $5 from our $55 bill. HA! We requested to speak with the manager who avoided us for 10 minutes before she came over and made excuses about it being busy and other people ordering specialty items. She continued to make excuses and said the best she would do is discount 10%. What a joke. I would never go back here if someone paid me.

You can never go wrong with a bar that serves breakfast lunch and Dinner.. This place has delicious homemade dishes daily! Food presentation makes your eyes bigger than your stomach! A must try for anyone looking for a different new place!

We've been here a number of times and I still don't know why we come back.  Anything dealing with food is a train wreck.  The wait is always an hour or more, and the last 4 times several of the people at the table had to return their food because it was not cooked, or over cooked (burnt is what it was).  Today after waiting an hour and a half the food came out cold.  We sent the fried chicken back because it was so cold, and when the new plate came out, it was hot but raw in the center.  I'm done eating here.  I may come to have drinks, but never to eat.  Eat here at your own risk.  You've been warned!  If I could less than a star I would.

I used to love this place now its disgusting.  The last 3 times we went we hated it. Freezer burnt, old, bland, food. The cheese balls aren't even the same! What a waste of money on garbage food.  Disgusting! Save yourself and go almost anywhere else!

Cains had great wings and good service. The Jamaican jerk wings were very crispy as I did request them to be extra well done. The jalepeno cheddar could have been a little more crispy. The sweet potato fries were delicious, but they could have been warmer. Service was great, overall a great atmosphere and experience and would go back again!
So yeah the wings are good just know some sauce choices are a dry rub. The fries are fresh cut, not hot when they came out   Oh ps no losers here, good atmosphere!

Very disappointed in this place. The food was pretty good, I'll give them that....but the owner was inappropriate to say the least. He wouldn't leave my female friend alone and got extremely inappropriate with her to the point we were forced to leave bc she was uncomfortable with his never-ending inappropriateness. We are never going back.

I have eaten here plenty of times and its usually really good.. But all of the pretzel bun sandwiches aren't that great. I think they need to go.  I got the 3 little pigs the other day and the meats on my sandwhich were all cold. The appz were good but the rest of my meal was kinda aweful. waitress said a new menu is coming so hopefully they get back on track.This place used to be a solid 4 stars but the last few times here have been bad. They do have a great brunch though and a killer atmosphere for games so I'll give them another try once the new menu is here.
Good local bar with lots of TVs, good draft selection, and better than average bar food. Definitely a step up from the Saloon.

Sunday afternoon, I walked into this place. Steelers game was game was on TV, the place was packed with fans. They advertise a good selection of beers, but did not have what I liked - Sam Adam's Octoberfest. Com'on its end of September. Fortunately found a place to sit. I was very hungry so ordered food- fish fry or fried fish. A basic salad came along, plenty of green, tomatoes and cucumbers. Not enough dressing. Fish was dry and nothing to crow about, just very basic or less. Not impressed. Fresh fries were soft and sticky. They gave a lot of food but the quantity does not make up for quality. The bartender was great, very friendly. Well one can say perhaps too friendly, given his propensity of using the f-word.

Came here for a breakfast with my bf this morning. Was surprised that bar was full. Nice atmosphere and music. Waitress are polite. The only issue that its been almost one and half hours we are sitting here and still don't have any food.  Asked to refill my coffee and got a cold one. Unbelievable.

Wow my Mom,husband and I had dinner there yesterday from a ad in the paper with Valentine's specials for the whole month of February. We ordered the Surf and Turf special. It started with a salad I had their classic which was HUGE and SUPER DELISH !!! The classic salad was a generous amount of spring mix,tomato,cucumber,purple onion,peppercini.   They have so many salad dressing choices not your ordinary blahzay boring choices. The spinach salad was also AMAZING spinach walnuts,feta,cranberries. The Caesar is what you would expect generous portion but average.  Then a soup choice of French onion or soup de jour  (soup of the day) my husband had the french onion Wow he said it was prepared perfect and how french onion should be served a nice crock full and nice amount of cheese covering and balance of bread and soup. My mom and I had the soup of the day which was a roasted red pepper mushroom soup this was a soup we had never experienced and boy was it fabbie definitely a soup we shall enjoy again.  Now the main course.   a 6 oz Filet Mignon and 4-5 oz Lobster tail , Twice baked potato, Fresh white asparagus.   The steak was cooked PERFECT my Mom and I ordered med rare my husband ordered his med and there was not an issue with either.  If all this wasn't enough choice of homemade desserts  was carrot cake    or brownie a la mode.we all chose the brownie a la mode. It was HUGE the brownie was like a 4x4 brownie with a HUGE scoop of ice cream.   Service was EXCELLENT our waitress was on top of things couldn't ask for better what an amazing establishment ! A true hidden GEM !!!    All of this for 19.99 !!!!

We have lived near this restaurant for decades but never visited because my husband and I don't typically go to bars.  Saw their ad in a local paper that listed their new summer dinner specials. What a pleasant surprise! I got the lobster ravioli with spinach salad, broccoli and cheese soup and homemade dessert.  The portions were HUGE!  Never have I had a salad with dinner that I could not finish but I could only eat half of the spinach salad.  The lobster ravioli was unbelievably tasty and came with garlic bread.  I could only eat part of this dish too for I needed to reserve space for the homemade brownie a la mode which was also quite large. Took most of this home too and had another whole meal the next day.  My meal price was only $14.99!!! My husband got the filet mignon and crab cake special with equally large portions with a price of $16.99. The service was impeccable and we definitely will go back.  The only problem was the lighting; the bulb to the lamp hanging in the center of the table was partially exposed and it was hard to look across the table.

Came for breakfast. Kim the "manager" was mean from the time we walked in the door.  We tried to sit at a table but she told us they had a big party coming. Then, she sat 2 small parties there.  90 minutes later, after those people had gotten food and eaten, we asked about our breakfast.  We were then told it would be ANOTHER 15 minutes.  Funny thing is, my friend had told me how horrible the service is and how mean the chick at the front acts.  We tried to give them the benefit of the doubt.  Bad idea.  This place is a bad idea all around. One star that belongs to the bald bartender.

Came here to grab a late lunch and watch the NCAA tournament. The atmosphere is pretty good for drinks and sports and the food is pretty good for a bar. I got a crock of chili and the grilled cheese  and was pleasantly  surprised by the quality and the portion. My wife enjoyed the Cain Club with waffle fries, although  she noted her turkey was kinda dry (we did take hers to go so that may be a factor). The one issue I noticed was that our table was not cleaned off from the prior customers so we had to use napkins and the menus to do that. The wait staff was friend and attentive otherwise. If I was a local I would definitely  return.

Just brought home a "steak hoagie". If you like bad steak in a bun with nothing else on it then this is your hoagie. No lettuce, no cheese, no nothing. I am shocked and surprised and totally disappointed.

It's hit or miss for me. I used to love their breakfast but when I went the other day it just was not the same. Menu definitely changed. Lots and I mean lots of regulars. They're opening the top floor which will be nice but hopefully doesn't bring even more regulars, but that's what businesses like this thrive off of so I can respect that.   Lunch/Dinner/Apps are great. Wide selection and fair prices. Although when I sit in the bar I would prefer not to have the tables right next to the bathroom. When people come in and out you constantly get the lingering smell of toiler bowl cleaner mixed with your food.
It was our first visit to Cains and we were very pleased. Food was very good and reasonably priced. We will be back if ever in Dormont

Some of the food and drink items are overpriced.  After waiting forever to get served, my food turned out to be horrible and was sent back..this entire visit was a disappointment.  No reason to ever go back.

It's nice to have a local resturant/bar that you can walk to. Cain's is ours. The service is always friendly and good. The prices are fair and it is always clean. I would have given it five stars instead of four, but some nights the food is better than others. I think it depends on who is cooking on a given night. It is never bad, sometimes it is great. Thursday night's prime rib specials are particularly good.
Yum! Bloody Mary bar is my favorite, especially during game days on Sunday's! I would love to see an expansion of an outdoor space for the summer time! That would be SO FUN! Love love Cains!!!

Almost but not quite perfect. Cain's is a well-priced smoke free 1/2 bar 1/2 sports restaurant hybrid. The front has tall tables and chairs (like bar stool height) and the back has booths and 6 flatscreen TV's. The whole place was redone in 2009 when a new owner bought it, who bought Redbeards in Mt. Washington and totally redid it. The chef is from Grand View, a fantastic actual restaurant, not bar restaurant. So you're basically getting, at normal bar food prices, truly excellent bar food. Seems like the truly scuzzy clientele that someone 3 years ago mentioned have been evaporated to cheaper Dormont bars. The patrons here are more of the youngish (under 40) Mt. Lebanon variety.  The vegetable wrap is phenomenal, the burgers are great, and the "Codfather" gigantic fish sandwich is simply amazing, the best outside of Wholey's. The "Codfather" is prepared 3 ways - "Part 1" is tartar, lettuce tomato, "Part 2" is coleslaw, fries and hot sauce and I forget what "Part 3" is. The onion rings are beer battered (not breaded) and fried to perfection. They taste moderately of beer, the true hallmark of excellent rings. The food you're getting here isn't pushing any envelopes but it absolutely is the best bar food in Pittsburgh. Apparently they have a $5 "express lunch" that includes a 1/2 sandwich and soup or salad. Never had it but that's extremely cheap.  Beer is fairly priced; Sam Adams and Blue Moon are $3.50 while Yuengling, Coors & Miller are about $2.50, $2 on special. Everything else is under $5.50.  Wing night Wednesdays the good: 25 cent wing night. Best wings I've had in the 'burgh. Wing night the bad: they charge 50 cents per ranch or blue cheese dressing, effectively making 10 wings (the minimum order, which they DON'T disclose) $3 rather than $2.50 which makes it more like 30 cent wing night. Nor do they include celery/carrots, as they do on the menu for regular wing orders. This is the first Wednesday (wing night) they've done this upcharge. I don't mind 30 cent wings, I just like honesty up front. They also don't let you take the wings home that you don't finish. Sorry, but I want two flavors and don't want to weigh 300 pounds so I'm only gonna eat 12-14 wings. We threw away at least a dozen between the 2 of us. People go hungry in this city every night and that's a crime.  The mild buffalo wings are more like medium buffalo wings and are excellent, as are the orange ginger wings. The bbq and honey bbq are what you'd expect. The jalapeno cheddar is fake nacho cheese and pickled jalapenos on top - NOT what we expected and not what we'd get again but still very good.  Service is good 4/5 times. It's slower with wing night; only 2 servers for the whole place.  Definitely go here for the Codfather and the veggie wrap. Get onion rings as your side. Oh! And get a salad too; they use spring mix and baby spinach and make almost all of their dressings.

I really wish I could give this shit hole a zero but I have to give something. First we get in at 7 pm and after where seated we wait a good 15 mins for our waiter to show up to take our beer orders. Another 15 mins later and still no beer, another 5 mins we finally get the beer and of course everyone's beer is flat. Another god damn 15 mins later still no beer or waitress to take our food order. Finally after about an hour we get set with our beers and food, our damn food is ice cold. At this point I'm fed up along with everyone else and we call over the manager. This little dick head comes over and starts yelling at the four of us saying we either have a choice to eat or get out. We were more than happy to get the hell out of there with the shitest service and cold ass food ever. The long and short of it is that if you want to have a even good or a sorta good experience at diner without being told by a manager that I should stop talking, do not ever go to this place. Never ever go to this place if you even want to have a meal, or a hot meal if I should say, because this place will bend you over, grab the broom by the handle and sweep your ass out the door with it.    I've never had someone esp a manager tell me to eat or get out. That's all I have to say.

I can't believe this place hasn't been reviewed. If you are thinking about going here know this:  If you grew up in the South Hills, all the people from high school that turned out to be real losers will be hanging out here. (Hey, I've been there, so I am not throwing stones.)  It is otherwise your typical South Pittsburgh yinzer bar. There is always a seat, and there are free pretzels.

I'm actually sad to write this. Cain's was the best brunch in Pittsburgh. I reviewed this place at five stars four years ago. Since then I've seen it go downhill pretty drastically. Our service today was incredibly slow - 25 minutes to get drinks! We asked to order 15 minutes after that and were told no, as out server had to take other orders first. The once-famous bloody Mary bar was barely stocked and had much fewer to select from.   Our food arrived in advance of our silverware and was cold. Ever have cold eggs? It's awful. The server dropped the food and never once checked on us again. 45 minutes later we finally managed to flag him down and pay for our cold food. Although we had our cards out and ready to go, he still kept us waiting after dropping off the checks.   Tl;Dr: used to be the best. Now among the worst. Go somewhere else.

I Work close and have tried and tried again to like Cains.. it takes forever to get food then once you do one part or another is normally cold , if you are lucky enough to get a hot Sandwich then the fries are cold.. never fails.. it's hard to get a refill, the larger older bartender/waiter  knows nothing about customer service and is loud and inappropriate. I now know that the upstairs is not completed because "Joey ran out of money.... Again"  That's nobody's business.... Maybe Joey should let you go and use the money for the remodel. Tuesday was the final straw.. Its taco Tuesday, there are 3 other tables of 2 to 4 people and 3 or 4 sitting at the bar..  it took 1 hour to get "the special" steak tacos and they were cold when they hit the table.. even tried calling in To-go orders and they are either wrong when you open them up or not ready for 15 to 20 min after you were told. Sorry Cains but you have lost many of the people I work with for the same reasons and we can hit your building with a rock from where we are.  We wanna love you but you need to pull it together.

I came here for my first time the other day and was extremely suprised at what I found. This has an very nice bar area with an excellent draft beer selection and great tasting appetizers. I had the hot wings which I for one was extremely happy with. I would have given this 5 stars but I did wait a very long time for my wings, and to be honest I don't think I would have received them if I wouldn't have asked the Bartender about it. I was not that disappointed though because it allowed me to try another variety of beers on tap.  I will definitely go back soon!

Well, currently I am so bored with waiting on my food that I've decided to write a review. I've been sitting here for approximately 45 minutes and have managed to be served a melting glass of tea in a plastic bar cup. It is so extremely loud I can barely rhink to type so forgive any errors due to my brain being overwhelmed by the amount of sound it is sorting through. I understand it is a bar, however I am sitting in the rear of the establishment thinking it would be calmer, quite the opposite.   The restroom looks like a college bar on a Saturday night, and it's Wednesday, in Dormont. There is honestly no excuse for clogged toilets, paper towels all over and water all over the floor.   Overall, after finally being served, the wings were mediocre, at least they were .35cents because it was nothing to write home about. I think I'll make the short commute to Moon and eat at Wings, Suds & Spuds where the service and atmosphere are wayy better. My Hot Garlic Parmesan wings tasted like they were rolled in Frank's Red Hot then Creole seasoning and finally sprinkled with parmesan, I've definitely had better.   I understand that yes, it is a bar. However, considering that 98% of the patrons were adults over the age of 23, it sounded like a crowd of kindergarten children each yelling over the other. I was sitting across the table from my date and couldn't hear him but could clearly hear the two tables next to us and the booth behind him, have some common courtesy and manners.   After reading the other reviews regarding weekend visits, I think it goes without saying  will not be returning, no matter what, nor recommending this place. It appears to be under staffed, unorganized, and mismanaged. The drink specials, are hardly deals when you compare them to a train ride to the SauthSide or the likes.   May the townies continue to disappoint and should old stories from 15 years ago, that'll be rhw only patrons but, if that keeps them in business, so be it.

The food is mediocre. There is nothing special about this place. It's in Dormont, trying to be Mt. Lebanon and a lost cause. It's like every other sports bar, and there are several which I prefer to this one!  Go there if you want to leave sorry that you wasted your money.  Most of the staff is also rude (complaining about making Irish Car Bombs, or accusing patrons of being "shady" if they join a table).  The staff that isn't rude is indifferent. And none of them are aesthetically pleasing enough to have this attitude.  Two weeks later and still NO response from the business and Yelp! won't post my review because they are bias and political.

Let me start by saying that first you get bombarded by the bouncer for your ID the second you walk in the door. Next, you'll get a wobbly table so that your drink spills all over your table. If that wasn't bad enough, your server might even shake your table and spill it some more just to  be sure. Then, the loaded fries you ordered two days ago that came out on a normal size plate with a portion to share between two people, all of the sudden comes out on a small plate with HALF THE PORTION FOR $9.00..AND SERVED THEM WITH DIRTY PLATES! GROSS! My friend and I kindly explained to the manager that the portion and plate size was different than what it was two days ago. We were aware there was a change in the menu a month ago, but not since we were there TWO days ago. Instead of making the situation better, the manager blamed the kitchen for serving the wrong portion size two days ago. She then raised her voice with us and continued to argue about the situation. I have never experienced such terrible customer service and unprofessionalism. Save yourself the time and money and go to "The Saloon" restaurant down the street instead of Cain's. If I could give this place zero stars, I would.

I have to admit, when i read the most recent reviews of Cain's, i was skeptical. It seemed like the service and food quality has declined since Cain's first opened. I am here to let you know that i was delightfully impressed with my experience at Cain's. My coworkers and i met here for breakfast last Saturday. When i walked in, the place was pretty empty, but nice and cozy. I was told our group could either sit in the bar area or the dining room. We chose the dining room because it was quieter. Upon first glance, i noticed they had a Bloody Mary and mimosa bar. The Bloody Mary bar wasn't as extravagant as other places I'd been to, but it had all the necessary basics. I got a Bloody Mary and made it to my liking!   I will say that Cain's has a lot of breakfast food options... sandwiches, pancakes, waffles, frittatas, flatbreads, burritos, Benedict's.. and i could keep going. I settled on a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. I know it sounds basic, but you could get a pretzel bun as an option for bread, so they had me sold! My sandwich had a ton of bacon. The cheese and egg weren't lacking either. It was so good! The sandwich cake with home fries, which were nothing exciting. I skipped those and just ate my sandwich.   Our server Jill was new, but she was prompt and super friendly. I would definitely go back to Cain's again. I had a really great experience!

Service was extremely slow to begin with.  Not a big deal being that i was visisting with friends and in no hurry.  Took over a half hour to have our order taken. Ordered my food and of course an hour and a half after sitting down it was received.  Go figure cooked, but cold.    When I told them that it was cold they tried microwaving it.  They ended up making a new one  and the wait was over 20 minutes.  I should have taken the microwaved food, because this time it was hot on the outside and frozen on the inside.  real great to bite into.  heard lots of great things about this place, but I can not say it was at all good.  Will never go back.
Cain's Saloon has very good buffalo hot wings and sandwiches.  It gets a little noisy and crowded on the weekends, but the food is great.

I really should give this 1 start but I hate to do that and their food is not bad. It's the service-they just can't get it right.  We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 10 and it was busy but not packed. Well you would have thought it was Super Bowl Sunday with the Steelers winning they way the wait staff was acting. We were seated and a booth opened up right after we sat down so we jumped at the chance to move. Our waitress greeted us and apologized that they just seated all the tables in her section at once and she would be with us as soon as she can. It was a few minutes later that she took our order-ok no problem. We all got eggs of some sort. Well 40 minutes later we are starting to get restless and other tables that came in after us are getting served. We asked our waitress multiple times what is going on and she apologized and said she should have told us from the beginning that it takes a minimum of 45 minutes to get your food. Seriously are you kidding?  That is crazy for eggs even on the busiest of days.  After an hour and ten minutes had passed we could wait no longer and were headed out the door-I have never done this before but it was getting ridiculous.  On our way out the waitress stopped us as our food was there.  I got an egg, cheese and bacon sandwich on a bagel. It was not bad.  My fiancé ordered a steak and cheese sandwich with a friend egg and they forgot the fried egg. He was so hungry by this point it did not even matter.  The waitress apologized again as she knew we were not happy. We asked her 3 different times for the manager and he never once came to see us.  On top of all of that they did not even give us a free orange juice, We had to pay for the entire meal.  On our way out the waitress said she hopes this will not prevent us from coming back-well it does unfortunately. We had 2 guests from out of town with us that were appalled by this service.  I was also really disappointed with the manager for not taking the time to settle this-all it would have taken was a free entrée or two.  The only thing I can end with is I recommend you stay away from this place for brunch and know going in you will have bad service because the food is pretty good.

This place is just average. The service is subpar at best and the waitresses always seem rushed. However, their wings and wing flavors are good, and they have so many tv's there isn't a bad seat in the house if you're there for a game. Now that the parking lot across the street is gone, good luck looking for a spot. I would go back, but only for the wings and the spicy cheese bites.

I decided to try someplace different and I have passed Cain's in my travels.  I will start with the good.  I liked my waitress. She was nice and attentive.  There were many beers on tap to choose from.  I started with a house salad and found it to be yummy.  The french fries were hand cut.  There is a section on the menu for barbecue and I decided to try the ribs.  They touted that they slow cooked the meats.  I have eaten great barbecue in my life and this was not it.  The ribs were dry and overlooked.  It did not seem like authentic slow cooked ribs to me.  I barely ate half of the order.  I'm sure that there is better food at this restaurant but I'll pass on the barbecue in the future.

Rude bartender, asked for ID and when returning my ID he basically just throw it to me. Also didn't seem very nice. He thinks he is cool or trying to impress the waitress. Very annoyed and ignorant! Review base on October 25.

Best breakfast in the city! We come here every weekend to get the famous Bloody Mary bar and the food is awesome too! Rhett and Selena are awesome bartenders and will make your experience here unforgettable!

Ok.  This used to be our favorite spot in the area but the past two times we have been here were not the best.   Today's meal was cold burnt and  rubbery.  We had fish and chips.  Burnt mushy fish and cold over cooked chips.  Loaded potato soup was so thick you could use it for paste.  The app we had was the best part of the meal.     The last time we wets here my fiancé got food poisoning from a burger special.     I'm beginning to think we need to go elsewhere from now on.
Great place to watch a game. Friendly staff went out of their way to get my game on even though the Steelers were on at the same time.

This place used to be very good. The service was slow and we were given the wrong check. Then they started getting very cheap on the food. No longer offering fresh cut fries and the amount of sauce on the wings is almost no existent.   Looks like they are cutting corners to make more money. Not sure if we will be back

Average bar food, slow service, a nice selection of incredibly overpriced beers. My parents RAVED about this place from when they were regulars years ago, but needless to say when I have a hoagie & decent beer craving, I'll be going elsewhere.
My favorite place in Dormont/Mt Lebanon area. Stuff is fantastic. Food will surprise you: better than most restaurants.

Meh, I've never had an exceptional experience here.  Some pros are it's location and it's proximity to me and the variety of the menu. I like their offerings and when you look at the menu, it looks fantastic. However, some cons are the incredibly slow service and the food is just not that great.   I've been here on many occasions and it's never really my first pick. But then you look at the menu, and you think for a second it might turn out just fine. It always goes downhill after you're seated. Incredibly long wait times for the wait staff to get your drinks, your orders, and then your food. Plan to be here a few hours.   My last visit was during brunch. Boy does the brunch menu look fantastic, but execution just was not there. I ordered the chicken and waffle. If you like your chicken extra extra extra crispy, you might enjoy their chicken. If you like a dense waffle, you might like their waffles. For me, everything was just a bit too tough to chew on. I will say the flavors were ok, but the texture ruined it for me.   Overall, I'm not a fan. I return for its central location and somehow, the online menu always lures me in to only make a fool out of me later.

Yum.   I love when places surprise you! Brunch is my passion so I am always on the hunt for new spots. I love the Pamela's scene but sometimes you need that bloody mary to hold you off until you can dig into your home fries.   BLOODY MARY BAR, O HEY!   Pros: breakfast and booze, huge portions ( I got a side of oatmeal and it was double a meal portion), CHEAP!!!!, Early hours   Cons: Parking is a bitch, slower (a huge party sat before us though)   Def will be back for some day drinking

I've had countless bad experiences with this place... it's a shame because the food is good. It's just poorly managed and owned.   I went to school at south hills beauty academy it is located next door and I would order lunch every week. When you eat in you get good portions for the price, although if you decide to get a Togo order they will over charge you and give you 1/4 of the food you would receive by dining in. For example I ordered a salad Togo and got 8 pieces of lettuce.  Another example.... One day on my lunch break I had 30 extra minutes so instead of picking up my Togo order I kindly asked the owner if he minded if I ate my meal there. He said that would be no problem... so I ordered a drink and when the waitress brought it to me she rudely said "next time you order Togo food you better not eat it here" I kindly told her the owner told me it was ok and she responded "he sent me over here to tell you because he's so pissed that you would make us waste togo containers"  I then asked the waitress to go get the owner and I saw her talking to him but he never was brave enough to talk to me. I thought this was very distasteful and made me feel really uncomfortable.  Overall a very shady place and the workers are childish/petty!
It was ok. Food was good Service not bad. Didn't appreciate the ceiling fans blowing on my food. Coffee good.

I wasn't expecting much but they surely over delivered.  I thought it was just another bar.  It had the bar vibe.  I didn't think the food would be this good.  I am impressed that most of the food is made in-house.  I actually don't remember what I got since it was several weeks ago that I went.  All I know was that the food was much better than any bar food I had.  I would come here again.

Cain's Saloon has popped up on my radar repeatedly since it opened - many people have stood by it as a fantastic dinner spot and bar. And while I certainly didn't dislike my experience here overall I can't say I quite get what all the fuss is about.  I came here for dinner and drinks with a friend and upon first entering we were pleased; the staff got us seats and our waitress very patiently helped us navigate their beer and cider options - which took a while, there were just so many! I truly do praise our waitress and the bar staff for taking my companion's final request, which was a little off-menu. No one complained and they whipped up my friend's drink while I went for a Pear Magner cider.   The particular night that we went was wing night, and while wings did sound wonderful we ultimately went for a plate of loaded fries in addition to our separate meals. It took a while to get them, but we figured it was getting busier since it was the evening and we let that slide. Here was where the meal began to lose some of its shine - while at first the fries were absolutely delicious, the more of them that I ate the less appetizing they tasted. I suspect that while the top layer was composed of perfectly cooked fries, the last layer of fries at the bottom of the plate was just drenched in extra grease and oil that kind of ruined the fries themselves for me. Plus, when ordering my sandwich I had asked for one of three sauce options listed on the menu - but once it arrived I realized after biting into it that my sandwich contained the wrong sauce. I didn't bother complaining at that point because of how busy it was - I didn't want to wait for a replacement meal; the sauce I got wasn't too bad or spicy for me, so the sandwich itself still tasted good, but it was still a bit frustrating. After actually finishing our meal, it took an INCREDIBLY long time for us to spot our waitress and flag her down for our check. We're not sure why she disappeared for so long; it was definitely odd to have our service go from above average to below average.  And when we ducked into the bathroom on our way out? Good Lord, was that a tiny room! I almost hit someone with the door because you literally only have a foot or two between the door when it opens and the wall, so if anyone is standing on the other side they're often in the door's way by default. And it was almost impossible to sit in the stalls, they were so tiny. Definitely be careful when entering the bathrooms, folks.  Needless to say, my experience was pretty mixed - it definitely started out strong but it kind of went downhill throughout the night, although it never hit actual flat-out bad levels. I'd still come back to Cain's if someone wanted to, as their food was certainly enjoyable enough. It's absolutely a decent place with some decent options for food. It just wasn't incredibly impressive to me after all the hype I'd heard.

I love Cain's. The night time staff is the best. Especially John. Great food. They made me and my girlfriend regulars there. I am very happy everytime I walk in. If anyone reads this and you decide to go then please get the Brisket Sandwich. It is amazing. I have never moaned while eating, but while eating this sandwich I did.

We had a party at Cain's on a night they have all you can eat crab legs. We had over 20 people show up to enjoy good company and food.  The food was amazing!!  Crab legs kept coming out as we needed them, even with this many people we had no delay in our food. The service was super friendly and the atmosphere in the back room was very relaxed. I was nervous bringing my kids, but there was no problem at all and the  just loved the food also.  When desert came, I have to say I was totally floored with the banana foster, it was just heavenly.   I highly recommend stopping in and getting a fabulous meal.

Best brunch in town! These guys know what's up at least for breakfast. Full bloody Mary bar heavy on the champagne mimosas and mom sooo good breakfast menu- big too. It's hard to find a p,ace that has this great of food for so little money.
Great atmosphere for breakfast ! Loved the bloody Mary bar ! Thanks Dana  would love to see Chris and Aaron again

My wife and I wanted to try Cain's after we got a Yelp email around Halloween that highlighted the best Bloody Mary's in Pittsburgh. We bookmarked the places and figured eventually we'd hit them all. I called on a Wednesday in February one afternoon asking what time they served breakfast on Sunday's. My wife and I were celebrating our 1 year anniversary and wanted to grab brunch after we had gone for massages in the morning, somewhere laid back that we could also watch the olympics. When I called I didn't see the Yelp page that mentioned no reservations so I asked anyway. I spoke to Joe Demarco(sp?) who was AWESOME! When I told Joey that we wouldn't be able to make it there until 12:30 (they stop serving breakfast at noon) he told me not to worry and that they'd make an exception for us. When we arrived on Sunday they had a table cleared and were ready for us. The food was fantastic! I got the Harvest Benedict (sauteed spinach and a veggie burger with a poached egg smothered in hollandaise). As a vegeterian I like to see stuff like this on the menu, creative veggie fare. The homefries were crispy and well done, and the hollandaise was rich and creamy. The bloody mary bar was a pretty cool idea as well. We had 2 each and enjoyed switching it up a little with the mixers and the various toppings. Nice job with pickles and the blue cheese stuffed olives! The wait staff was super friendly and extremely kind. When we got our bill we were told that Joey had gotten our first round of drinks! Way to go Cain's! You delivered a solid meal, excellent service and a great atmosphere. We'll definitely bring friends here and come back soon!
Awesome fun place!!! The place is always busy, the servers are attentive and the food is delicious.. The wings are cooked perfectly! It's your true pittsburgh bar with seating for dinner in the back!

I had some beers and dinner here on a Thursday night. They have a really good selection of craft beers and a nice list that describes a little about the beers to help you make a choice. On Thursday craft beers are $2 off, which is a pretty good deal.   They have a big menu as others have noted, but Thursday was prime rib special night with a choice of prime rib plate or prime rib hoagie. I got the hoagie which came with steak fries. The hoagies was really big and I had to cut it in three pieces. There was a lot of meat and melted cheese, but it was real dry. I was expecting a little more moist and juicy prime rib. The steak fries were ok, but did not taste like they were from freshly cut potatoes.   Service was good at the bar. The food took a little while to get to me, but I didn't care much since I wasn't in a rush.   The place was pretty crowded and friendly. There are a lot of screens playing different games. This is a nice, fun place to relax.

Came to Cain's for a business lunch and was not disappointed! My companion selected the location and though I was skeptical, it turned out to be a great place for a meeting and a tasty bite.   We sat at a booth in the back section and it was quiet and well lit, perfect for a meeting. Our waitress was unobtrusive but made suggestions, pointing us towards the lunch special menu, which was awesome!   For 7.99 you have a TON of choices for a combo lunch that includes choices of sliders, half-sandwiches (great choices and a very large half!) and a warm and cold side. You even get to choose the bread for your sandwich.   I had the grilled chicken on italian bread with sides of sweet potato fries and fruit salad. My companion had a similar combo but with mac and cheese as the hot side.   The sandwich was large and filling and the chicken was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The bread was soft but toasted crispy. The sweet potato fries were the waffle variety and were just the right amount of crispy on the outside. The fruit salad had alot of variety and everything was fresh.   The mac and cheese was HUGE and looked really good. The combo was a GREAT DEAL any way you slice it.   I was really pleasantly surprised by Cain's and will definitely return when in the area.

Cain's is a great local bar/restaurant located right in the heart of Dormont. I have been here a few times over the years because it is relatively close to my parent's house and have never had a bad experience. A group of 12 of use went on Sunday afternoon for my grandfather's birthday. We made reservations ahead of time and they were very accommodating to our group and it wasn't too crowded. We missed the brunch (it ends at 12 on Sunday) but still were able to make mimosas & bloody Mary's from the mimosa/bloody mary bar. I made a mimosa and my dad had the bloody mary bar. Both were pretty good!   For lunch, I ordered a cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. The cheeseburger was just OK but I really enjoyed the fries! We also got an order of the hot garlic parmesan wings for the table to share, which were amazing! Next time I come back I will for sure order wings again. Last but not least, our waitress, Kimmy was great! She was very helpful and was so sweet to my 96 year old grandfather! We couldn't have asked for a better waitress to help him celebrate his birthday.

Ate here for lunch today. Was really noisy due to two big parties. I ordered the turkey club with onion rings. Rings were awesome!! Sandwich was really good, turkey was really tender and flavorful. The bread was just toasted enough to give it texture without being hard.  My fiancé had the 3 little pigs with the sweet potato waffle fries. He loved the sandwich. Also, both portions were huge!! I took home half my sandwich and probably 2/3 my onion rings.   I knocked off one star for service. We didn't have the issues that other people have had, but our waitress wasn't very friendly. I cannot stand when people in costumer service aren't friendly. Even when you're not having a bad day, you cannot take it out on the customer.   With all that being said, I'd definitely go back if I'm in the area again.

I can barely write this because I'm so dang full.  I'd really give this place 3.5 stars.  Huge beer selection and the food - wow!  are the portions huge and it's really good bar food.    Our waitress was adorable and very attentive. I still can't get over how huge the sandwich was.  To drink I got the leinenkugel grapefruit shandy and it light and delightful it was practically a health drink :-)   For dinner I got the Cain's Club which is turkey breast, peppered bacon, and egg with pepper jack, lettuce, tomato, and horsey sauce served on a pretzel bun. First of all, let's be real - everything tastes better with an egg on it-I just wish there was a little more horsey sauce  on it but it was huge and the bread was so good!    My hubby got the Pittsburgher which is a 1/2 pound burger (he got it as a turkey burger) topped with sautéed onions, 3 pierogies, cheddar cheese and horseradish sauce.  So crazy.    All their sandwiches come with 1 side item - I opted for the onion rings and hubby got the sweet potato waffle fries - both were amazing. I seriously can't breathe because I'm so full.    If you're looking for great bar food - lots of beer selection and a great staff - you should come here. You won't leave hungry ....
Cains best thing by far is their breakfast.

I've been to Cain's quite a few times, since I live right down the street.   The best times I have had at Cain's consist of myself going into the establishment with the predetermined mentality of spending way too much for drinks ( $7.00 for a Jameson and Ginger!!??) and already being three sheets to the wind.   Don't get me wrong, if you like going to a place that mildly reminds me more of a mosh pit at times than an actual drinking establishment, you would love Cain's. Definitely, avoid going on the weekends.  But, I will admit that Cain's is an awesome place to post up at the bar, drink a few beers, and catch a Pen's game on one of their million TV's.   Bottom line : This place is not a place where you and your buds can go and get poopy drunk at. Cains is, at best, a bar where you stop during a bar crawl for a beer and a shot.   Nothing more, and nothing less.

I think this placed has been re-modeled or at least that is what my buddy thought. I had never been there before so I had nothing to compare it to. They had over 25 beers on tap which was very nice. The menu seemed good and the appetizers we had were tasty. There were not a lot of places to sit but we found a couple of seats at a table. They have at least 4 or 5 TV's to watch whatever local sports are on. I think my friend will be going back more now that it has been updated and I will only be back on my next trip to Pittsburgh. Parking is street, the service was good, and it seems like a nice local place to hang out for a few cocktails.

Our night at Cain started out as 4/5 stars.  This was my first visit and I was blown away by the extensive menu and attentive service.  I ordered the Shrimp and Strawberry salad - not something I would usually order at a bar.  But I was not disappointed! The shrimp were of a decent size and seasoned well. The salad was huge and at $12 was just right.  My guests ordered a variety of items including Buffalo Chicken dip (amazing); Spinach Artichoke Dip (great); and for their entrees - the Grilled Romaine salad topped with Filet; Surf and Turf ($14 - WHAT?); and a Steak and Egg something sandwich. Everyone seemed delighted with their respective meals and the drinks flowed all night long thanks to our wonderful server whose name I cannot recall.    Unfortunately, as the evening progressed the bouncer began his shift. Sigh.  I'm sorry, but he just wasn't nice. Not that bouncers need to be cuddly, but dang.  We were seated at the table closest to the door, a table which he clearly despises.  He rudely asked us (the two people seated in the outer seats) to move closer into the table when there was really nowhere for us to go; citing that patrons walking in couldn't do so with us sitting there. Lies.  There was plenty of room for anyone to walk anywhere.  He repeatedly got an attitude with one of our guests both vocally and with his body language; going so far as to seat his stool so close to our table that shoulders were touching. Get over yourself, dude.  I'll visit Cains again, but either won't go when there's a bouncer on duty (which is a ridiculous thing to have to do); or request a table away from the door and annoy the hostess. Either way, he's not a great ambassador for what I'm sure is a great place.
My husband and I love Cain's Saloon. The food is great, the drink selection is quite good, and it's a great atmosphere to watch a football and/or hockey game. We come here quite often.

Have to dock stars off my previous review for the absurd prices. Every appetizer is $10 now? Burger almost $15?  Wow did the prices go way up. Like a previous reviewer wrote, 20% more than similar establishments in the area. Not a bad place to grab a drink, but avoid the overpriced food.

Good, All-American bar food.  This is J and my go-to spot when we are in the mood for something good, reasonably priced and close to home.  We have been many times, but the last time was especially awesome.   J ordered the full slab of ribs which came with fresh-cut fries and cole slaw.  While there was a bit too much BBQ sauce on the ribs, they were cooked perfectly, fall off the bone good.    I was in the mood for a good beer of which they have plenty.  While I normally would order an Abita Purple Haze, I was talked into some shandy that was on special.  Thursday specials are micro-brews - which means that we should really go every Thursday.  But I am getting off track.  When the waitress told me that there were two shandies on tap, she offered to give me a taste of the one in which I wasn't familiar.  The beer that came out was big enough that I didn't really need to order a full glass, but it was good enough that I wanted several.   We decided to split an order of the pepper jack cheese bites which were served with unnecessary ranch dressing.  The bites were awesome - cheesy, not greasy and excellent breading.  I ordered the California Turkey Hoagie with a side spinach salad.  The spinach salad has feta cheese, walnuts, dried cranberries and warm bacon dressing - all in all, a delicious spinach salad with fresh, crunchy spinach.  The hoagie has fresh turkey - that is featured in several sandwiches and meals and always delicious - avocado, pico de gallo, swiss cheese and lettuce.  I would probably trade out the swiss for maybe pepper jack, but other than that - the sandwich is perfect.    I know that this place is not everyone's cup of tea, but for my husband and I, it's good food, good beer and decent service.   The one thing that for me stopped me from giving it 5 stars is that it is so freaking loud in there.  Apparently, this is the hangout for people that want to get really drunk and be really loud - even if there is no need for it.  You generally have to kind of yell over to be heard, but if you can get past it, the food is worth it.

1 hour wait for apps. Came with another couple. Half the group got their food, the other half got their food 15 minutes later. One of the workers fully admitted that they served the French fries that were "supposed to be thrown out" from the old owner. Awkward/gross? Won't be back now that it's new ownership. Our waitress was sweet though!!

My friends and I heard this place was a hidden gem, so we were excited to check it out for a penguin's game the other week. It is located in Dormont and very close to Mt. Lebanon, parking wasn't terrible for us to find at all considering there were a few parking lots close by. It wasn't too crowded at all and we were seated right away. Our waitress was fantastic and kept a great eye on us the whole time. We started off with three, yes three, appetizers. We ordered the wings (the Cajun bbq), mozzarella sticks and fried pickles. The wings were incredible. The sauce was almost overwhelming because they gave us so much of it, but it was tasty as well. The wings themselves were juicy & cooked perfectly. The mozzarella sticks were huge and veryyyyy packed full with cheese. The fried pickles were pretty standard, but were tasty none the less. I then had the Bavarian chicken club and a side of the veggies that day (sautéed zucchini with tomatoes). The chicken club was awesome- the mustard, pretzel bun & bacon were delicious & the chicken was thick but juicy. Super good. The veggies were decent, but I wouldn't order them again. I stole some French fries from a friend's plate- they were delicious (I heard a lot about them from some coworkers). Their draft list was also decent and was categorized by the type of beer, which is always helpful. I also should point out that the dining area had a ton of tv's- which my boyfriend clearly loved while watching the pen's game.  Overall, we had a great experience & I am looking forward to returning!

Well, Cain's is ruined. AMPD Group came in and made changes. Portion sizes are smaller, menu is destroyed, prices increased, and happy hour is basically gone. It was fun while it lasted, just go elsewhere now.

Great beer list always changing it up. Follows the season. The food is good the Cuban press is one of my top picks. And you can't beat a wing night Wednesday. Sports fans if you can't get a game there on one of those tv your team must not be the good.
You can't go wrong with Cain's. The staff is friendly and the food is great. I'm a regular guest and I've never been disappointed. I highly recommend it.

Awful. Every time I've been here, something has been served ice cold. This could be a great place but their food is mediocre at best. The only redeeming quality would be the bartenders and wait staff but unfortunately it's not enough to earn a return trip after so many failures. Spend your money elsewhere.

From the moment we walked in I knew we were in for in for an interesting experience. Instead of being greeted with a smiling, friendly "Hi, welcome to cains" we were greeted with a frantically working, unhelpful, stressed out hostess who had no clue how to deal with the influx of people. We were there during a breakfast rush. When we walked in the hostess told us that it would be 45 minutes for the kitchen to prepare our food. Since we had known cains for their delicious breakfast, we thought the wait would be worth it. But an hour and fifteen minutes later we get our food. My Breakfast burrito tasted like nothing and a our food was cold. The only good thing about the experience was the warm donuts. Poor service, crappy food. Overall not the way a restaurant should be run.

They are in transition to new ownership. Hopefully it gets better when complete. I have been a Caines patron for years, but today's experience was awful. Food was bad, waitstaff overworked. Not a fan any more

Great specials from wing and shrimp night to brunch. They have a great menu, very good food, friendly staff and plenty of tvs. The only issue for me was parking isn't plentiful since its on street parking on West Liberty Avenue and the bathroom was a bit run down. I had bananas Fosters pancakes, bacon and a mimosa. They had fixins set up to add strawberries, blueberries and other fresh fruit. I loved it. The pancakes had a rum 4amd it was so outstanding I didn't eat syrup at all. The bacon was crispy and they gave me plenty. I enjoyed the server he's been there 17 years and he was a well versed on everything we asked. I'm looking forward to going back on a Wednesday for wings and shrimp. This place is great for sporting events there was a soccer game on when we were there so the tvs in the back had the game on while there was football in the bar area on the tvs. It was a nice blend and everyone was enjoying themselves. Its a feel good environment and I'm looking forward to going back.

Rising prices here have made my review drop. The menu changes on build your own burgers and omelets were basically designed to nickel and dime you into buying a $13-$20 instead of just having something like a western omelet or bacon cheeseburger.   I thoroughly enjoy the build your own bloody Mary bar and 35¢ wing night here. But prepare to pay 50¢ for each ranch and $1.50 for 4 carrot sticks or celery, what a ripoff.   Sports events are great here with all the big screen TVs as well as the beer selection and specials.   My favorite side is the sweet potatoe fries and the portions are enormous. Service here is usually very attentive even when the place is packed.

Great breakfast!  Been going here for breakfast for 3 years and it never disappoints.  The sausages are some of the best around and in general everything from the omelet to the pancakes are tasty and filling.  The bacon is thick and delicious.  Good coffee to boot.

Watched the Pirates with friends on a Sunday.  The bartenders were great!   The food was great!   I ordered their garlic / parm / hot wings per the recommendation of my bartender.  Great order.  The beer - I mixed up between a hoppy IPA and a 50/50 sour.   They have some beers on tap I have not seen at other bars.  You should check it out.   Sunday - the meters are free :-) - (Don't tell anyone).

I have been here a few times and in general thought more highly of the place than what I'm going to rate it now (and I would rate it lower if it weren't better experiences prior to my last visit). In general, this is a nice looking bar, with large and viewable, nice TVs, plus decent food with large portions. I especially recommend getting their enormous mozzarella sticks!  My problem was with our last trip this past Sunday. Service was a tad slow, but acceptable. The real issue was due to the fries. They look fresh cut, delicious looking, and just spudtacular. But they were not delicious. In fact, they were flat out gross and almost tasted like they had a strong chemical flavor and odor to boot. I think we can rule out the fryer if it was shared with the fish as it tasted fine. They were possibly the worst tasting fries I've ever had. I thought I was going to be poisoned or something if I ate more than the two I tried.  I've had their fries in the past and don't recall anything of the sort described previously. We didn't eat anymore of them (and I'm pretty sure no one else at the table ate more than a few of the fries tha came with their dishes). Hopefully this was a fluke, but it is concerning regardless.
I have been going to bars for 30 years, probably the rudest staff I have ever seen. Will NEVER go back!

Well, we literally live 2 minutes away and decided to try breakfast. It was myself, my wife, my cousin and his girlfriend together for a birthday brunch. It was about 1/2-3/4 full, not surprising for a Sunday. The arrived shortly before us and when we got there it took about 15 minutes to just to get coffee and water. I felt badly for our server Anita, who was nice but obviously stressed. I ordered 2 eggs fried hard, wheat toast and homefries; the wife ordered a French toast bowl, and I ordered donuts for the table. After waiting a considerable amount of time the donuts arrived; obviously the oil wasn't hot enough because they were soaked all the way through. So between the 4 of us we ate about 2.5 before the grease just became way too much. After another bit, our orders arrived. My eggs were far from the 'fried hard' that I ordered, and my wife didn't even get the right thing. I couldn't eat my eggs because the runnier, the grosser...to me and again not what I ordered. The toast was luke warm and the homefries had clearly been sitting alone in a dark corner asking for forgiveness before arriving at my table. Now my wife's dilemma. She ordered a french toast bowl with apples and pecans...what did she get? French toast triangles with canned apples on top. Seriously. She took a bite and immediately had to excuse herself; she got sick due to the oil in the donuts...as we don't normally eat greasy stuff; donuts shouldn't be dripping in grease. Regardless, the waitress was busy enough that we didn't see her often but once she stopped by I told her to go ahead and take my plate because the order wasn't cooked right, and she took it off the bill. Then when my wife's order was addressed she admitted that it was rung up wrong and what my wife got wasn't even on the menu; she hadn't even taken three bites of it and she didn't offer to take it off the menu....which is what should have been done. My wife had already gone home at this point so I just wanted to pay and get home to make sure she was okay. Never saw a manager, the food was terrible, staff was scant and it was just a bad time. Perhaps it was an off day, but after this I don't know that I will be up for giving it another shot.

HELLA SWEET BRUNCH!!  I really like Cains. I frequent this place for brunch. They have an excellent brunch drink menu which is pretty unique I think. Really great service and food to boot. Also , 33 beers on tap makes for a quality selection of brews. Good service and and atmosphere are a plus.   Great stuff

I really like this place i always got great food and awesome dessert. Seriously anything i have gotten here to eat has been bomb! I have gone here and just got dessert too. They have a bar and a well sized seati g area. Theres enough tvs so u can see from any angle.
Love coming here for their cheap wing night. They have a variety of great sauces and flavors to choose from. My boyfriend and I love coming here to have a drink and watch a good ol soccer game too.

When you go to a place to eat, you expect to wait but when does the wait go from being reasonable to this is a joke?  I came here with some friends on a Sunday. It was maybe 75% full, we got seated immediately. We did not get to order our drinks for 15 mins after being seated... that was a sign of things to come. After we received our waters, the waiter disappeared for a good 20mins. When he finally came back we put our orders in (pancakes, breakfast sandwiches etc, nothing complicated). The food took a minimum of 45mins with other tables being served well ahead of us though they came in 15-20mins after we did. I went to the waiter 2 separate times to remind him it's been 45mins and we have not been served. I hadn't eaten since the night before and it is Noon now so I was extremely hungry at this point. The food came and was average. What ticked me off was we received no apology or even a "sorry it took a minute." The only thing he said was "your food should be out in a minute, to which the entire table replied with, I should hope so seeing as we're nearing an hour." We also had something to do right after this but clearly the waiter could give two (you know what).  We literally ate in 3 mins time and ran out the door and was 30 mins late to our event.   I would not recommend this place, I would not come back. It's one thing to be apathetic and fake that you actually care about your customers but to not even acknowledge a huge short coming in service is p!ss poor. That was a first for me. Thanks a bunch "Ross C."
Draft selections are good...service is lousy...food is sub par. Not in a hurry to return.
Got a couple well drinks with friends.  Nice, casual atmosphere and decent prices.  Waitress had no issue splitting checks.
It's places like Cain's that are turning Dormont into a Pittsburgh hot spot. Great Beer selection, food is always good and the atmosphere is always pleasant.

if 0 stars was an option that would be the rating on this review. the second we entered the establishment, we were greeted by an extremely rude bald headed bouncer. made snide comments regarding my license expiring in 3 weeks, which is plenty of time to get a new license IMO. we had a group of 6 people and several of their larger bar top tables available. however, we were then scolded by several workers for blocking the aisle with 2 people sitting at the middle seats at the table and not even all 6. 2 gentleman were nice enough to switch us tables so we could be on the end and not "block any aisles". we proceeded to order drinks which were awful and flat. i had to go up to the bar because the servers were not great and not coming up to our table to inform the bartender the drinks were flat. however, both bartenders declined making the drinks and told me there is no possible way that soda water could be flat ever. 5 minutes later i was informed i was indeed correct and the soda water was flat and they asked if we wanted new drinks. by that point we just wanted to get out of there because the experience was terrible. overall cains is not great. go to the saloon or jameson's.

The wings were top notch, perfectly cooked and crispy. Freshly fried... honey habanero sauce was one of the best i've ever had. Service was also top notch. If you like sports, this place has TVs everywhere. I will definitely be back.
Good brunch spot for the weekends-- very casual, pleasant staff and Bloody Mary/ mimosa bar

So sad.  Cain's used to be a hoppin' place with great food.  One of the long standing authentically local Dormont establishments.  It has been here for decades.  This new restaurant group that bought it has completely ruined it.  The "Local" name - is just a slap in the face.  It's now a bad chain.  I fear that Cain's won't last long now.  The place has no vibe at all - it was dead - nearly empty - on a Friday night.  We were seated, yet after 15 minutes no one had come back to our table.  Service is terrible.  Aside from that, the prices are absolutely absurd.  Meals come with homemade chips now, not fries and cost on average about $13-14.  Sorry, but I am not paying $14 for a French dip, Rueben, or Burger and a side of chips.  Appetizers - how about $11 for fried pickles!!!  Yes, Pickles!!!  I am just so sad that Cain's sold out to this restaurant group - it used to be a great "local" place to eat, drink, and watch games.  I don't want to say to stay away because I want Dormont businesses to succeed, but I will honestly never return and I live within walking distance.

Yelp notified me that they had removed my previous review (perhaps someone complained about it). Alas, I will repost and now it will won't be buried under newer reviews.   I once had love for Cain's Saloon. It was a place where everybody knew my name. I would often boast of the hearty breakfast, accompanied by a make-your-own bloody mary bar on Sundays. I would always suggest it when friends asked me where to go. I was excited to bring family there for dinner.   The beer selection is great, and the specials for Pirates games brought me by almost 162 times a year. I was a brand loyalist - spending hundreds if not thousands of dollars on a place that I believed in.   But something changed. Without warning, without reason, without the Cain's love that I had grown so accustomed to - I was treated extremely rudely by a specific bartender who I will not name. And now those friends who I once brought along, and the family I would laugh with while eating gigantic cheese sticks, and the strangers I would tell to try Cain's for breakfast are a thing of the past.   I cannot speak for others. I only know that deep down in the fragments of my broken heart, I cannot return to Cain's to spend another penny. Such a shame because between the guests I brought and the money I spent - I know it was a lot of money. So much money - gone. Like a big ball of revenue that was so constant and so kind and always huge tips for the friendly staff and I was even thinking about spending more money just because I loved giving them so much money.   All that money spent elsewhere because of one power trip.  Sometimes I drive past Cain's. It still looks the same. I think about the good times had. One day when this particular bartender leaves I might return.... (END)  Oh also tons of TVs great for watching every sports game. :)

Went tonight for a quick salad. Ordered the Caesar salad with salmon. The salad came with maybe 3-4oz of salmon. I didn't pay much attention to the price but when my bill came it was an $18 salad. It was good but not worth $18.

Stopped in for breakfast today.  Pros:  -we were seated almost immediately, and it was crowded!   -the meals we got were great!  Cons: -service was super slow. We waited over 10 minutes for a server to take drink orders after we were seated. I had told my wife that we were going to leave if someone didn't come over in 3 minutes more. It wasn't just our server, it seemed like many tables were waiting a long time.

Have been going to Cain's for close to 10 years.  Loved their brunch, until today.  Kitchen got backed up, so it took over an hour to get our food.  No big deal.  Understood that happens.  Then when the food started rolling out, we had two separate hairs tangled in our food.  Since we were pretty grossed out, we asked for to-go containers for the food not impacted with hair & asked for the manager.  The manager came & said none of his cooks have hair & comped one of the dishes w/hair.  Will never go back.  Sad cause we've had good memories there over the years.

Cain's is okay, but I probably won't be back unless I'm with others who insist. The prices are absolutely absurd for the kind of establishment this is. I wouldn't be happy to pay $10 for a cheese sticks appetizer at an upscale place, but to do it at a divey bar/restaurant? YIKES. Huge turn off and I am kind of still in shock at how much their cheap food costs and definitely knocked off a star because of this. Not a single appetizer is under $10, let alone the prices of the actual meals. I'll be heading down the road to the many places on Washington next time for similar fare and at least one place that has a similar atmosphere at much more reasonable prices.  Plus, Cain's is LOUD. Too loud.   My food was ok. The loaded pulled pork nachos were delicious, but again, overpriced at $13.00. My steak wrap had very good steak, but not enough of it to actually fill the wrap. Probably about 1/3-1/2 of the wrap was just lettuce and cheese. The onion rings were good, though, and a generous portion. My friend's salmon wrap did not suffer the same problem as mine, and was chock full of fish.  I guess go if you want to overpay like crazy for American style fare you can find basically anywhere?

Hi there...went with a group of five for brunch today and things started off well. Coffee...water...good fun. Then we ordered...three of our party received their orders within 15 minutes and liked their food.   The fourth got his about 30 minutes later and his food was terrible. Cold. Greasy. Stale.   The fifth, me, never received the short stack of pancakes and eggs I ordered. Bad service by the wait staff and manager...they checked in with me and left to figure out where my order went several times. Then they'd come back and ask what's wrong as if they forgot they were already tasked to find my order.   Cain's is usually a good place but this morning they dropped the ball...and apparently my pancakes and eggs.

One week night we wanted to step out of the norm and try something different for us. Enter Cain's Saloon. Really... We entered Cain's Saloon. That sounds dirty but you know what I mean.   It was pretty busy in the initial bar area which has a bar to the left and tables to the right. While we prefer to sit at the bar we knew this would end up being a dining room trip based on the ongoing March Madness and the time we got there (Happy Hour). Our wait to be seated was really short and even the tables (rather than booths) feel roomy in the dining room. There are approximately 100 giant TVs inside between the bar and dining room. Well, ok, maybe not 100... but it's close maybe 97 TVs. This is a great place to watch whatever Sportball game your into, even in the dining room.   As soon as we were seated it started to really fill up. The place looks small but it fits a lot of people. While waiting for our waitress to come get our drink order I saw they used an online listing for the over 30 on tap craft beers. I love this because it allowed us to decide before she even got to us. They have a happy hour special of half price appetizers and Wednesday's are wing night.   We both ordered wings; mine boneless and his bone in (it's ok you can laugh, I'm 12 too). They took a while to come out due to how busy they were but they were so delicious. I was so happy with the food and how attentive our waitress was even though it was insanely busy.    The food prices were great, the beer/drink options are awesome, the staff is friendly, and the interior is darker and cozy. We will absolutely be back.

Stopped for something to eat on the way home from a steeler game. They have a pretty large menu but I just wanted something small. I went with the chili and we shared the mozzarella sticks. They mozzarella sticks were great! Actually like really good. They were fresh so it was like a thick stick of cheese. The chili was meh... My fiancé got a burger which looked good. I did like the fresh cut fries.

It's an alright place to drink, but don't order food. The food is always over cooked or burned. The prices are ridiculous for the quality you're getting. The service is decent. I don't go unless it's a last resort. Especially for food.

Cain's is a TREASURED INSTITUTION in Dormont, and of course, it's a neighborhood favorite  It's a lot better for those of us who don't live in Dormont now that there is a parking lot across the street, but do be careful if you are attempting to cross West Liberty Avenue during rush (happy) hour!  I've been stopping at Cain's since I can't remember when, and maybe their tap selection has something to do with that.  I have never failed to find something interesting and crafty on tap at Cain's.  My favorite night to stop at Cain's is Wednesday.  I try to get there early, because later in the evening, the place is usually packed out, even though there is a lot of seating.  On Wednesdays, Cain's has a special on their excellent chicken wings.  They are done the right way, and among my top favorites in the South Hills.  You can't go wrong at Cain's during happy hour.  Half price on all appetizers and a dollar off all drinks from 5 to 7.  But my favorite plan of attack at Cain's is to arrive around 4:45 and order the "half sandwich and a soup" deal they call "express lunch."  It is served until 5:00, and you can't beat a half sandwich and two sides for $5.99.  By the time my food arrives, it's happy hour and the beers are a buck off, but you have to be seated in the bar area, supposedly.  My favorite sandwich to get with this deal is the Reuben, served with some volcano chili and slaw, but I've had other interesting sandwiches there as well.  The chili has got some NICE punch to it, and I am definitely a fan.  I remember way back when this place wasn't so pretty, but they have done a nice job with updating the place and you won't be embarrassed to bring a date to this place.  But don't be surprised if you end up having to stand for quite a while before you can get a seat on a Wednesday night.  Chivalry is not dead in Dormont, which is one of my favorite parts of the South Hills, and I have seen young men give up their seats in favor of older ladies at Cain's.  Good people.
Great beer selection and awesome food ! Fun environment for sporting events! Servers and bartenders were all very nice too !
Has become one of my favorite breakfast spots.  Was already one of my favorite places to watch a game (TVs cover ever imch of this place - just get there early!).  Great bar food, friendly staff.

My husband & I have been here probably a dozen times.  Never once have we had a bad experience.  The menu has a large variety, and everything we've tried has been excellent!...best wings I've ever eaten!!!   Portions are huge and very reasonably priced.  Huge beer selection.  Bartendars are quick & friendly.  Great place to watch games....tons of TV's.     Only con:  The bar area isn't that big, so it fills up quickly.  Oh, and the parking lot that was across the street, is no longer there!
Great wings, good service, good beer selection. Hardly fine dining, but great bar food!

Went to Cain's today for breakfast and was so excited to pick from the crazy assortment of French toast they have. However, they changed the menu! A friend and I could not decide and decided to order french toast and biscuists and gravy. This did not dissapont. You could smell the cinnamon from the French toast and the bread was just the right amount of softness without being soggy. The biscuits and gravy was fantastic. The salty spice mixture of the sausage combined with the sweet butteriness of the biscuits worked perfectly. Cain's again did not dissapont!
